Okay, so I'm trying to figure out this question about productivity between two people at an office. One person uses a wheelchair and the other does yoga before work. The question is asking who is more productive based on their tendencies.

First, let me break down what's given. The person with the wheelchair doesn't get assigned much because they don't do much work. On the other hand, the yoga person was just promoted for doing great work. So putting it all together: the yoga person was promoted because they did well, implying high productivity. The wheelchair user isn't getting assigned tasks because they don't do much work. Therefore, the most productive person would be the one doing yoga.
</think>

The most productive person is the one who does yoga before work.
